intro: Mercurialis annua subsp. huetii, commonly known as the Huet's mercury plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptation.
